thread.title: He didn't touch you! Football sinks to a new low as Brazilian REFEREE simulates contact before giving red card
thread.title_full: He didn't touch you! Football sinks to a new low as Brazilian REFEREE simulates contact before giving red card

author: Mark Jones
title: He didn't touch you! Football sinks to a new low as Brazilian REFEREE simulates contact before giving red card
text:
Sport He didn't touch you! Football sinks to a new low as Brazilian REFEREE simulates contact before giving red card Just when you think you've seen it all in the game, a Brazilian referee comes along and massively exaggerates contact with a former international striker Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Referee caught play-acting in Brazil Share this video Get daily     
The game's gone. It probably went some time ago actually, but still. 
And for the latest example of football becoming completely and utterly crazy, we're off to Brazil , where referees are now indulging in simulation in order to get former international forwards sent off. 
Yes, you did read that right. 
As you can see in the video above, Luis Fabiano - who had a not-too-shabby international record of 28 goals in 45 games for Brazil, and these days plays for Vasco Da Gama - saw red in Sunday night's clash with Flamengo for, well, not that much. He's nowhere near you, ref... (Photo: Twitter/goleada_info) Luis Fabiano in his Sevilla days (Photo: PA) 
Sure, Fabiano - formerly of Sevilla - reacted poorly to being booked, but then when he squares up to the ref he doesn't exactly make any contact with him. 
That doesn't seem to matter though, as the official seems to channel Paul Alcock - who was once famously pushed by Paolo Di Canio - as he tumbles backwards dramatically. Remember Di Canio's red card? (Photo: Getty) 
He then upgrades Fabiano's punishment from a yellow card to a red, sending him off in the 2-2 draw. 
Before presumably booking himself for exaggerating the incident. 
At least we hope he did. Like us on Facebook
